thread.title: vivo V5 Plus and V5 Lite with all-metal design and 5.5-inch displays officially unveiled
thread.title_full: vivo V5 Plus and V5 Lite with all-metal design and 5.5-inch displays officially unveiled

title: vivo V5 Plus and V5 Lite with all-metal design and 5.5-inch displays officially unveiled
text:
vivo V5 Plus and V5 Lite with all-metal design and 5.5-inch displays... vivo V5 Plus and V5 Lite with all-metal design and 5.5-inch displays officially unveiled By January 19, 2017 “The V5 Plus and V5 Lite are mid-range Android phablets with selfie flash” 
Earlier this week, the vivo V5 Plus went on pre-order Malaysia ahead of its official unveiling. Now the company has officially unveiled the V5 Plus alongside its smaller sibling, the vivo V5 Lite. Both new vivo phones flaunt a premium all-metal design. The vivo V5 Plus also gets a fingerprint sensor, which is integrated into its home button. 
The vivo V5 Plus’ main highlight is its dual camera setup on the front – a 20MP Sony IMX376 sensor + an 8MP shooter for depth sensing. The phone gets LED flash for both the selfie and rear cameras. At the rear, it houses a 16MP primary snapper with 4K video recording. As for the other specs, the phone comes with a 5.5-inch full HD display with 2.5D curved Gorilla Glass 5 on top. Under the hood, it packs in a Qualcomm Snapdragon 625 SoC, mated to 4GB of RAM. 
The V5 Plus comes with 64GB of internal storage, and boots Funtouch OS 3.0, which is based on Android Marshmalow. The phone offers a custom-made AK4376 dedicated Hi-Fi audio chip, which provides a signal-to-noise ratio of up to 115dB. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and GPS. A 3,160mAh battery keeps the device alive. 
As for the vivo V5 Lite, the phone comes with a single 16MP selfie camera with the selfie softlight flash. At the rear, it features a 13MP primary shooter with an LED flash and f/2.2 aperture. The phone comes with a 5.5-inch HD display, and is powered by a 64-bit octa-core processor of unknown make, mated to 3GB of RAM. It offers 32GB of expandable storage, Funtouch OS 3.0 based on Marshmallow and a 3,000mAh battery. The connectivity features are the same as the V5 Plus. 
vivo hasn’t revealed the price of the V5 Plus and V5 Lite at the moment. The V5 Plus’ price as per a Malaysian retailer is around Rs 27,400. The V5 Plus is all set to launch in India on January 23rd, so stay tuned. Facebook Comments
